Flower Shop Mystery: Mum's the Word
programme.desc:
The Young Messiah: Directed by Cyrus Nowrasteh. With Adam Greaves-Neal, Sara Lazzaro, Vincent Walsh, Finn Ireland. Tells the story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth. Told from his childhood perspective, it follows young Jesus as he grows into his religious identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1002563/","name":"The Young Messiah","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NzM3NzczMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzM0NjkwNzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6026206/","name":"Adam Greaves-Neal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909906/","name":"Vincent Walsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3322537/","name":"Sara Lazzaro"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637493/","name":"Cyrus Nowrasteh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043365/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232424/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637492/","name":"Betsy Giffen Nowrasteh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637493/","name":"Cyrus Nowrasteh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0723351/","name":"Anne Rice"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2382672665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMjM4NDI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ0NjU4NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMjM4NDI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ0NjU4NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth."},"datePublished":"2016-03-11","description":"Tells the story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth. Told from his childhood perspective, it follows young Jesus as he grows into his religious identity.","keywords":"israel,jesus christ character,1st century,messiah,based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1002563/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rmay17"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Real Winner","reviewBody":"Absent any strong evidence, no one can say when our young Messiah was informed (or by whom) that He was the Son of God. Approach this film with that knowledge and you will love it. 

I think the film was extremely well-done and Sean Bean as the relentless Centurion charged with killing the young Messiah was outstanding. Period. The script was very believable and Jesus was neither over-played nor under-played. As a Christian, I found myself in tears through much of the movie... sometimes happy ones and some that were evoked in thoughts of how young Jesus and His family had to have suffered.

My wife and I both feel that faith-based films are being more widely received by the general public and as a result, story lines are improved, directing is much better, and the quality of actors is very much better. Hollywood seems to finally be getting the message.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3284,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: "Flower Shop Mysteries" Snipped in the Bud
Tajemnice kwiaciarni: Bukiet
Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud
programme.desc:
Snipped in the Bud: Directed by Bradley Walsh. With Brooke Shields, Brennan Elliott, Kate Drummond, Daniel Kash. Ex-lawyer florist Abby delivers black roses at college. Returning minutes later, she finds an old rival murdered. She's prime suspect. She investigates. Her ex-PI boyfriend helps." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVEpisode","url":"/title/tt5459456/","name":"Snipped in the Bud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGE5NTk0MTQtYjAzYi00YTEzLTk0YzctNmRkODYyNjcyOTczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgyNDE3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ex-lawyer florist Abby delivers black roses at college. Returning minutes later, she finds an old rival murdered. She's prime suspect. She investigates. Her ex-PI boyfriend helps.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5459456/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"So what's the motive?","reviewBody":"The second Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped In The Bud has our lawyer/florist making a personal delivery of flowers to the law school at her alma mater and to Professor Jeff Teravainen. Only Brooke Shields finds she's delivered her flowers to a corpse. Unfortunately she also touched an item at the crime scene.

Which puts her as number one suspect for Detective Paulino Nunes. I could so identify with this part of the story. In my days at NYS Crime Victims Board I saw cases where the police just got an idea and stuck with it and sometimes they were wrong in their theory of the crime. The fact that Brooke had no motive at all for killing this man who was a very popular professor didn't seem to make no differences to Nunes.

So with the help of boyfriend Brennan Elliott and some counsel from Beau Bridges her dad, Brooke manages to come up with a nice list of suspects.

I have to say the one who did it was not one I suspected. That's always the biggest factor for me in evaluating a mystery film. I don't think you'll figure it out either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2016-04-24","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3170877209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlmNDA2MTgtZjA4Zi00ZTdhLTkwNTQtOTQ0NzE1NTliZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlmNDA2MTgtZjA4Zi00ZTdhLTkwNTQtOTQ0NzE1NTliZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000222/","name":"Brooke Shields"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254392/","name":"Brennan Elliott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3399528/","name":"Kate Drummond"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909568/","name":"Bradley Walsh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0408514/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0581675/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0575177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7739636/","name":"Kate Collins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326211/","name":"Gary Goldstein"}],"duration":"PT2H","timeRequired":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Flower Shop Mystery: Mum's the Word
programme.desc:
The Young Messiah: Directed by Cyrus Nowrasteh. With Adam Greaves-Neal, Sara Lazzaro, Vincent Walsh, Finn Ireland. Tells the story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth. Told from his childhood perspective, it follows young Jesus as he grows into his religious identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1002563/","name":"The Young Messiah","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NzM3NzczMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzM0NjkwNzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6026206/","name":"Adam Greaves-Neal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909906/","name":"Vincent Walsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3322537/","name":"Sara Lazzaro"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637493/","name":"Cyrus Nowrasteh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043365/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232424/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637492/","name":"Betsy Giffen Nowrasteh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637493/","name":"Cyrus Nowrasteh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0723351/","name":"Anne Rice"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2382672665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMjM4NDI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ0NjU4NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMjM4NDI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ0NjU4NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth."},"datePublished":"2016-03-11","description":"Tells the story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth. Told from his childhood perspective, it follows young Jesus as he grows into his religious identity.","keywords":"israel,jesus christ character,1st century,messiah,based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1002563/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rmay17"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Real Winner","reviewBody":"Absent any strong evidence, no one can say when our young Messiah was informed (or by whom) that He was the Son of God. Approach this film with that knowledge and you will love it. 

I think the film was extremely well-done and Sean Bean as the relentless Centurion charged with killing the young Messiah was outstanding. Period. The script was very believable and Jesus was neither over-played nor under-played. As a Christian, I found myself in tears through much of the movie... sometimes happy ones and some that were evoked in thoughts of how young Jesus and His family had to have suffered.

My wife and I both feel that faith-based films are being more widely received by the general public and as a result, story lines are improved, directing is much better, and the quality of actors is very much better. Hollywood seems to finally be getting the message.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3284,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: "Flower Shop Mysteries" Snipped in the Bud
Tajemnice kwiaciarni: Bukiet
Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud
programme.desc:
Snipped in the Bud: Directed by Bradley Walsh. With Brooke Shields, Brennan Elliott, Kate Drummond, Daniel Kash. Ex-lawyer florist Abby delivers black roses at college. Returning minutes later, she finds an old rival murdered. She's prime suspect. She investigates. Her ex-PI boyfriend helps." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVEpisode","url":"/title/tt5459456/","name":"Snipped in the Bud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGE5NTk0MTQtYjAzYi00YTEzLTk0YzctNmRkODYyNjcyOTczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgyNDE3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ex-lawyer florist Abby delivers black roses at college. Returning minutes later, she finds an old rival murdered. She's prime suspect. She investigates. Her ex-PI boyfriend helps.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5459456/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"So what's the motive?","reviewBody":"The second Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped In The Bud has our lawyer/florist making a personal delivery of flowers to the law school at her alma mater and to Professor Jeff Teravainen. Only Brooke Shields finds she's delivered her flowers to a corpse. Unfortunately she also touched an item at the crime scene.

Which puts her as number one suspect for Detective Paulino Nunes. I could so identify with this part of the story. In my days at NYS Crime Victims Board I saw cases where the police just got an idea and stuck with it and sometimes they were wrong in their theory of the crime. The fact that Brooke had no motive at all for killing this man who was a very popular professor didn't seem to make no differences to Nunes.

So with the help of boyfriend Brennan Elliott and some counsel from Beau Bridges her dad, Brooke manages to come up with a nice list of suspects.

I have to say the one who did it was not one I suspected. That's always the biggest factor for me in evaluating a mystery film. I don't think you'll figure it out either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2016-04-24","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3170877209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlmNDA2MTgtZjA4Zi00ZTdhLTkwNTQtOTQ0NzE1NTliZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlmNDA2MTgtZjA4Zi00ZTdhLTkwNTQtOTQ0NzE1NTliZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000222/","name":"Brooke Shields"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254392/","name":"Brennan Elliott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3399528/","name":"Kate Drummond"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909568/","name":"Bradley Walsh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0408514/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0581675/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0575177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7739636/","name":"Kate Collins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326211/","name":"Gary Goldstein"}],"duration":"PT2H","timeRequired":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Told from his childhood perspective, it follows young Jesus as he grows into his religious identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1002563/","name":"The Young Messiah","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NzM3NzczMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzM0NjkwNzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6026206/","name":"Adam Greaves-Neal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909906/","name":"Vincent Walsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3322537/","name":"Sara Lazzaro"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637493/","name":"Cyrus Nowrasteh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043365/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232424/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637492/","name":"Betsy Giffen Nowrasteh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0637493/","name":"Cyrus Nowrasteh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0723351/","name":"Anne Rice"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2382672665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMjM4NDI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ0NjU4NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMjM4NDI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ0NjU4NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth."},"datePublished":"2016-03-11","description":"Tells the story of Jesus Christ at age seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth. Told from his childhood perspective, it follows young Jesus as he grows into his religious identity.","keywords":"israel,jesus christ character,1st century,messiah,based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1002563/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rmay17"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Real Winner","reviewBody":"Absent any strong evidence, no one can say when our young Messiah was informed (or by whom) that He was the Son of God. Approach this film with that knowledge and you will love it. 

I think the film was extremely well-done and Sean Bean as the relentless Centurion charged with killing the young Messiah was outstanding. Period. The script was very believable and Jesus was neither over-played nor under-played. As a Christian, I found myself in tears through much of the movie... sometimes happy ones and some that were evoked in thoughts of how young Jesus and His family had to have suffered.

My wife and I both feel that faith-based films are being more widely received by the general public and as a result, story lines are improved, directing is much better, and the quality of actors is very much better. Hollywood seems to finally be getting the message.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3284,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: "Flower Shop Mysteries" Snipped in the Bud
Tajemnice kwiaciarni: Bukiet
Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud
programme.desc:
Snipped in the Bud: Directed by Bradley Walsh. With Brooke Shields, Brennan Elliott, Kate Drummond, Daniel Kash. Ex-lawyer florist Abby delivers black roses at college. Returning minutes later, she finds an old rival murdered. She's prime suspect. She investigates. Her ex-PI boyfriend helps." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVEpisode","url":"/title/tt5459456/","name":"Snipped in the Bud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGE5NTk0MTQtYjAzYi00YTEzLTk0YzctNmRkODYyNjcyOTczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgyNDE3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ex-lawyer florist Abby delivers black roses at college. Returning minutes later, she finds an old rival murdered. She's prime suspect. She investigates. Her ex-PI boyfriend helps.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5459456/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"So what's the motive?","reviewBody":"The second Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped In The Bud has our lawyer/florist making a personal delivery of flowers to the law school at her alma mater and to Professor Jeff Teravainen. Only Brooke Shields finds she's delivered her flowers to a corpse. Unfortunately she also touched an item at the crime scene.

Which puts her as number one suspect for Detective Paulino Nunes. I could so identify with this part of the story. In my days at NYS Crime Victims Board I saw cases where the police just got an idea and stuck with it and sometimes they were wrong in their theory of the crime. The fact that Brooke had no motive at all for killing this man who was a very popular professor didn't seem to make no differences to Nunes.

So with the help of boyfriend Brennan Elliott and some counsel from Beau Bridges her dad, Brooke manages to come up with a nice list of suspects.

I have to say the one who did it was not one I suspected. That's always the biggest factor for me in evaluating a mystery film. I don't think you'll figure it out either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2016-04-24","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3170877209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlmNDA2MTgtZjA4Zi00ZTdhLTkwNTQtOTQ0NzE1NTliZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlmNDA2MTgtZjA4Zi00ZTdhLTkwNTQtOTQ0NzE1NTliZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000222/","name":"Brooke Shields"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254392/","name":"Brennan Elliott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3399528/","name":"Kate Drummond"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909568/","name":"Bradley Walsh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0408514/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0581675/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0575177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7739636/","name":"Kate Collins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326211/","name":"Gary Goldstein"}],"duration":"PT2H","timeRequired":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

man","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"daveandthomas"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nothing special","reviewBody":"Keep your expectations low and you'll enjoy 'Good Luck Chuck.' Overall, the movie is generic and predictable. Cook and Alba do good jobs with a paper-thin script and add some great moments with the physical humor such as the flying dental tools and jump starting Dane Cook as seen in the trailer. However, this is also one of those movies where most of the best punchlines are in the trailer which is disappointing.

Expect lots of nudity from everyone including Cook but not Alba. 'Chuck' comes well stocked with lots of naked girls and breast jokes. However, be warned if you're trying to make this a date movie and know there are some very crude parts to this movie. 'Chuck' definitely earns his 'R' rating.

Cook doesn't evolve much from 'Employee of the Month' here but he is enjoyable. Alba is decent at the comedy. Together they have a alright chemistry but the movie is so typical it takes away from the overall experience. 

One last note. Cook's sidekick, played by Dan Fogler, is extremely annoying and ruins the momentum of the movie on more than one occasion.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86610,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

In order to keep the woman of his dreams from falling for another guy, Charlie Logan has to break the curse that has made him wildly popular with single women: Sleep with Charlie once, and the next you meet will be your true love."},"datePublished":"2007-09-21","description":"In order to keep the woman of his dreams from falling for another guy, Charlie Logan has to break the curse that has made him wildly popular with single women: Sleep with Charlie once, and the next man you meet will be your true love","keywords":"sex scene,true love,sex in bed,leg spreading,lesbian has sex with man","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"daveandthomas"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nothing special","reviewBody":"Keep your expectations low and you'll enjoy 'Good Luck Chuck.' Overall, the movie is generic and predictable. Cook and Alba do good jobs with a paper-thin script and add some great moments with the physical humor such as the flying dental tools and jump starting Dane Cook as seen in the trailer. However, this is also one of those movies where most of the best punchlines are in the trailer which is disappointing.

Expect lots of nudity from everyone including Cook but not Alba. 'Chuck' comes well stocked with lots of naked girls and breast jokes. However, be warned if you're trying to make this a date movie and know there are some very crude parts to this movie. 'Chuck' definitely earns his 'R' rating.

Cook doesn't evolve much from 'Employee of the Month' here but he is enjoyable. Alba is decent at the comedy. Together they have a alright chemistry but the movie is so typical it takes away from the overall experience. 

One last note. Cook's sidekick, played by Dan Fogler, is extremely annoying and ruins the momentum of the movie on more than one occasion.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86610,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

Cook's sidekick, played by Dan Fogler, is extremely annoying and ruins the momentum of the movie on more than one occasion.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86610,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

The legend associated with the monastery bode revelation in him a saint in the near future. Despite initial reluctance, Natasha starts the maintenance of the image stored there. programme.title: Chocolate Road
Słodka droga do czekolady
Chocolate Road
programme.desc: Chocolate Road: Directed by Tanya Chuturkova. With Frances Louise Bekele, Joe Cullen Brown, Martin Christy, Elvin Ovidio Ávila Flores. Three renowned chocolatiers - Maribel Lieberman, Susumu Koyama and Mikkel Friis-Holm - take us through the process of craft chocolate-making all the way from the tree to the final chocolate piece. On their journey, each of them finds how important it is to know the roots of their primer material - the cacao bean, and how they can highly impact the lives of the people involved in the chocolate production chain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9866220/","name":"Chocolate Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExMzg3NmMtMzM0ZC00M2E0LWJkMzMtNjUyZjk1NTAwZWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjEzNjUxNTM@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Documentary"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11418139/","name":"Frances Louise Bekele"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11418155/","name":"Joe Cullen Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11418142/","name":"Martin Christy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4978936/","name":"Tanya Chuturkova"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0788856/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0331343/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0788857/"}],"datePublished":"2021-02-18","description":"Three renowned chocolatiers - Maribel Lieberman, Susumu Koyama and Mikkel Friis-Holm - take us through the process of craft chocolate-making all the way from the tree to the final chocolate piece. Braveheart: Directed by Mel Gibson. With James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo. Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112573/","name":"Braveheart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMmU0YTYtOWM3My00YzBmLWI0YzctOGYyNTkwMWE5MTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001526/","name":"Patrick McGoohan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000700/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042559/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078539/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908824/","name":"Randall Wallace"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2874063641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"1995-05-24","description":"Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.","keywords":"scotland,revolt,legend,secret marriage,based on true story","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112573/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"heisenberg12"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a Masterpiece. Best Movie of All Time","reviewBody":"Braveheart is the best movie ever made in history, an absolute sculpted work of art that depicts every emotion of human existence, from suffering, to courage to love, in front of the background of political astuteness and socio-hierarchal analysis.

Telling the quasi-true story of one man's conviction and courage to exact vengeance for the killing of his first wife and father at the hands of the ruthless King Edward the II of England, who in turn inspires his small province of Scotland to rebel and go to war in a real fight for freedom and independence, Braveheart is a stunning depiction of the capacity of the human spirit to overcome the odds, defy tyranny, and achieve justice, respect, and dignity against oppression.

Although its retractors and critics will dwell and harp on the historical accuracy of some of the movie, particularly what part Robert the Bruce played in real life, there is no denying the true power and emotional influence of this movie. It's understandable, particularly for Europeans, how this could be problematic due to their upbringing in studying history, but the movie is not really about being historically perfect; it's a work of art about things much deeper. A documentary it is not, and it's duplistic and hypocritical for the film's haters to dwell on this minor detail, but perhaps allow historical rewriting to slide and give it a free pass in something like Tarantino's Inglourious Basterds or Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.

On this topic, one of the dozens of best parts in the movie is when Robert the Bruce plays an important role in one of the battles, and eventually the movie does come around and get Robert's history back on track with more accuracy as to his part and character in the battle for Scotland's independence.

Without trying to get the history perfect, this movie is simply flawless. It's beyond flawless, really. A flawless movie can just be a technical masterpiece with very little power, but the raw power and emotion coming off the screen in practically every single scene in Braveheart is like an inferno.

James Horner's score is one of the greatest scores ever for any movie, and it successfully enhances the drama and emotion of each scene, without coming across as manipulative. It fits perfectly into every single scene it is used.

There isn't one acting role that is not well-done. This is one of Gibson's best acting roles, and the guy who plays Edward II gives an outstanding performance.

This is the greatest epic movie ever created in the history of Hollywood. A few years later, another great modern epic Gladiator came out and drew rightful comparisons to Braveheart, but while Gladiator is a very good movie, it lacks in the emotional depth, power, and ultimate inspiration behind the experience of watching Braveheart.

The final Act of Braveheart is one of the most powerful ever put on film. As a first time viewer, you really have no idea where the story is going to go (even as a repeat viewer it still holds weight). To this day, there is still nothing like it. Just when you think it's over or you know how it will end, it just continues to twist and turn, and then it closes with what is probably the best ending of any movie in history.

In addition to all of this, the body of Braveheart is loaded with outstanding battle scenes, incredible editing, and great dialogue rooted in inspiration, political strategy, philosophy, and stunning human experience of love, desire, passion, suffering, and identity.

When you look at the top rated movies on IMDB, it is laughable that comic book movies and good popcorn-fun movies are actually rated above this. This is without a doubt, hands down, one of the top 25 movies ever made, and in my opinion, it is the #1 best movie of all-time.

This movie is a masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":979631,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"duration":"PT2H58M"}</script><metacontent="

Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"datePublished":"2000-02-11","description":"On vacation in Thailand, Richard sets out for an island rumored to be a solitary beach paradise.","keywords":"thailand,travel,beach,island,pretentiousness","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0163978/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"stamper"},"dateCreated":"2000-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty good, despite all the bad reviews I've read","reviewBody":"I went to this one, knowing that it could be crap, but hey, I do not care what others think and once again this way of thinking did not prove me wrong.

This flick is basically about a young twenty who goes away on a trip to Thailand by himself, because he wants to forget his past. There he meets a loony (Robert Carlyle) who gives him a map to a secret paradise. He asks two strangers, Françoise (Virginie Ledoyen who was really great in her first big American Film and good looking too by the way) and Etienne (Guillaume Canet) to come and join them.

After they have found the island they meet an alternative group who lives there and they join them, but after a while problems evolve and a minor 'hell' breaks loose.

This is the plain story-line of the movie, but there is so much more to it, it has a message and that really is what fascinated me a lot in the beginning and at the end. There was a good story there, but the way it was brought over, never really losing the actual message out of sight. Now believe me the direction, the soundtrack and the cast are good. There also is a bit gore, but it fits good in the movie and is not unnecessary.

Yet this film is not flawless, it was good entertainment over all, yes and it was very good in the beginning and in the end, but in the middle when Richard (Leonardo DiCaprio) loses it, so does the film and that is a shame. It is just too weird, too long and too incomprehensible (in the sense that the viewer himself doesn't know if it is real or not). It could have been so much better, but I guess it had to be.

NO MUST SEE BUT DEFINATELY WORTH A TRIP TO THE VIDEOSTORE OR TO THE CINEMA AT A DISCOUNT!!!!!!!!

7 out of 10

P.S. Don't agree?????, sue me!!!!!!!!!!! or mail me (see above)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":227396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
25 lat niewinności. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
programme.desc:
25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy: Directed by Jan Holoubek. With Piotr Trojan, Agata Kulesza, Dariusz Chojnacki, Jan Frycz. The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11368998/","name":"25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E3YWNhMTgtMzRiZS00N2UxLWJkYzEtOGYyMWFhNDhlZmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11368998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"v-26640"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful movie about how person can be sentenced on circumstantial evidences.","reviewBody":"Tomasz Komenda was sentenced about 3 years after the crime had been committed basing on simple idea - 'find me a man and we fill forge evidences against him'. What this move does not show is that at that time Attorney General, now deceased Lech Kaczynski had been urged that a killer is found and sentenced to silence medias hysteria and coverage about brutal murder and rape of that young girl. Later when the murder was put on Tomasz, he was publicly defamed by Lech Kaczynski. Despite Mr L. Kaczynski death in Smolensk plane crash and after Tomasz was exonerated, no polish public institution nor police have never apologized Tomasz for their actions, which is a standard practice in western democratic countries.

Not much changed in post-soviet bloc however after 1990 in terms of judiciary mentality. Human Rights Watch estimates that 1-3% of sentences in Poland may be those in which innocent people are sentenced just because either suspects were threatened by police to force to confess by beatings. No effective police control and their procedures exists as of today. You may call it a mafia or not but I believe it's not far from truth in Poland.

Personally I believe his family did not do enough to get him out of prison, a good lawyer would smash the case easily and he is worth every money, why did it happen 15 years later is a mystery for me.

As Tomasz said after his release, there are no good people in prisons , there is only evil.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":819,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-18","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3825975/","name":"Piotr Trojan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0474492/","name":"Agata Kulesza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621963/","name":"Dariusz Chojnacki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1733303/","name":"Andrzej Golda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace 2
ABBA: Historia największych przebojów
programme.desc: Szwedzka grupa ABBA znana jest z wielu hitów. Twórcy dokumentu przybliżą historie powstania tych największych z nich. Do tego grona należą m.in. legendarne piosenki "Mamma Mia", "Dancing Queen" oraz "The Winner Takes It All" . Widzowie zobaczą archiwalne nagrania ze studia, wywiady oraz rozmaite anegdoty związane z tymi popularnymi na całym świecie utworami. Dowiedzą się także, co było inspiracją do ich powstania.

wish everyone gets to see this special movie","reviewBody":"It is a shame that a meaningful film like this one is not promoted to get more people to watch it, because it contains many hard truths that Their world is about to get a lot bigger and a whole lot louder."},"datePublished":"2020-04-10","description":"When the Queen of the Hard Rock Trolls tries to take over all the Troll kingdoms, Queen Poppy and her friends try different ways to save all the Trolls.","keywords":"jukebox musical,second part,troll doll,troll,based on toy","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6587640/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CrazyCockatoo2003"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most forgettable movie I have ever seen. .","reviewBody":"In my opinion, this sequel is very forgettable at best when in comparison with Trolls 1, which is slightly better than this movie. The problem with this movie is that they have used so many clichés that it's not even funny. In fact, they used nearly every common cliché you can think of. Furthermore, why is Branch depressed again, and where the hell did DJ Suki go? What I did like about it however, is the impressive animation and the fact that they are diverse to other cultures by having certain music genres from other countries such as Korea, Africa and Scotland. If you are a fan of Trolls, I would recommend it, otherwise it's best not to watch this movie as you might get bored. Personally, I am glad this sequel went straight to digital because of how forgettable it was.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. programme.title: Misbehaviour
Niepokorna miss
Misbehaviour
programme.desc: Misbehaviour: Directed by Philippa Lowthorpe. With Keira Knightley, Greg Kinnear, Daniel Tiplady, Kajsa Mohammar. A group of women hatch a plan to disrupt the 1970 Miss World beauty competition in London." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9148706/","name":"Misbehaviour","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWM2Y2U4MGQtYjdlOS00NmM0LTkyZTktMWE3MDg2N2RmNTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women hatch a plan to disrupt the 1970 Miss World beauty competition in London.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9148706/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just a little too earnest and one-dimensional...","reviewBody":"Unfortunately, this takes a regrettably simplistic approach to a subject that really could have survived much more intense - and, frankly, satirical scrutiny. Set against a backdrop of increasing frustrations by young British women with their second class status, which they perceive to be epitomised by the vacuous sexploitation of women in the "Miss World Pageant"; we see Keira Knightley ("Sally") and a feisty Jesse Buckley ("Jo") decide to take the fight to the patriarchal establishment as they plot to disrupt the show and hopefully shame the powers that be (men and women) behind it. Whilst it certainly has credentials when dealing with objectification; it fails to even attempt to seriously reconcile how aspirations amongst women (and, perhaps more importantly, women of colour) from different parts of the world - and remember we are talking 1970, here - were not necessarily in alignment with the rather linear white middle-class protest agenda presented to us here. It has all the substance of a student rebellion movie, and that's a shame. Buckley is good, and Phyllis Logan as Knightley's mother "Evelyn" brings some sense of the conflict faced by older women vis-à-vis career v family; but all in all, this film is at best a lukewarm hors d'oeuvres for the true, ongoing, achievements of the "women's lib" movement...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7046,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2020-03-13","keywords":"1970s,beauty contest,women's liberation,sexism,feminist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2456141337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5NDBkMGMtYjcyOS00NTVkLWJjNjMtNWM4M2YyMjU4ZjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5NDBkMGMtYjcyOS00NTVkLWJjNjMtNWM4M2YyMjU4ZjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women hatch a plan to disrupt the 1970 Miss World beauty competition in London."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1813221/","name":"Gugu Mbatha-Raw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2976580/","name":"Jessie Buckley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1339400/","name":"Philippa Lowthorpe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0292451/","name":"Rebecca Frayn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960711/","name":"Gaby Chiappe"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

Set against a backdrop of increasing frustrations by young British women with their second class status, which they perceive to be epitomised by the vacuous sexploitation of women in the "Miss World Pageant"; we see Keira Knightley ("Sally") and a feisty Jesse Buckley ("Jo") decide to take the fight to the patriarchal establishment as they plot to disrupt the show and hopefully shame the powers that be (men and women) behind it. Whilst it certainly has credentials when dealing with objectification; it fails to even attempt to seriously reconcile how aspirations amongst women (and, perhaps more importantly, women of colour) from different parts of the world - and remember we are talking 1970, here - were not necessarily in alignment with the rather linear white middle-class protest agenda presented to us here. It has all the substance of a student rebellion movie, and that's a shame. Buckley is good, and Phyllis Logan as Knightley's mother "Evelyn" brings some sense of the conflict faced by older women vis-à-vis career v family; but all in all, this film is at best a lukewarm hors d'oeuvres for the true, ongoing, achievements of the "women's lib" movement...","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7046,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2020-03-13","keywords":"1970s,beauty contest,women's liberation,sexism,feminist","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2456141337","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5NDBkMGMtYjcyOS00NTVkLWJjNjMtNWM4M2YyMjU4ZjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5NDBkMGMtYjcyOS00NTVkLWJjNjMtNWM4M2YyMjU4ZjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women hatch a plan to disrupt the 1970 Miss World beauty competition in London.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1813221/","name":"Gugu Mbatha-Raw","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2976580/","name":"Jessie Buckley"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1339400/","name":"Philippa Lowthorpe"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0292451/","name":"Rebecca Frayn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960711/","name":"Gaby Chiappe"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Archive
Archiwum
Archive
programme.desc:
Archive: Directed by Gavin Rothery. With Theo James, Stacy Martin, Rhona Mitra, Peter Ferdinando. 2038: George Almore is working on a true human-equivalent AI. His latest prototype is almost ready. This sensitive phase is also the riskiest. Especially as he has a goal that must be hidden at all costs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6882604/","name":"Archive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzFkNTRiMzYtODM2MS00YWQ2LThkNTUtMDE1Y2E2YjAwYTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"2038: George Almore is working on a true human-equivalent AI. His latest prototype is almost ready. This sensitive phase is also the riskiest. Especially as he has a goal that must be hidden at all costs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6882604/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trainman269"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent effort on most fronts.","reviewBody":"I was just going to let this pass by, untill reading an interview with the director. Which drove me to this.

First the good. Slow burning but not too slow, good cinematography, decent acting. The robots J1 and J2 are excellent. Character development in the first 2/3rd's is good. The last 3rd let's it down, the shock ending is anything but a shock and simply burns the first parts down. I think the Toby Jones scene finished it for me in retrospect. Nothing to do with his performance which is great work as always, but it demonstrates the lack of closure the film winds up at by pulling the same tired twist as other, better works.

Hint. When being interviewed about your tripe filled film that ends with a tried and tested one, don't tell us you burned all the usual tropes in your search for originality.

A pity, as the emotional nuances provided by the bots ARE really good, it deserved a more eloquent ending to match the set up, which is done well. A solid 7.5.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16387,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2020-07-10","keywords":"dead wife,husband wife relationship,fatal car accident,artificial intelligence,surprise ending","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3911368217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDg2ZTIxNDItM2Y4OC00YThiLTkwYmQtMjcxZWUwYTRjM2NlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDg2ZTIxNDItM2Y4OC00YThiLTkwYmQtMjcxZWUwYTRjM2NlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"2038: George Almore is working on a true human-equivalent AI. programme.title: The Conjuring

The Congress
programme.desc:
The Conjuring: Directed by James Wan. With Vera Farmiga, Patrick Wilson, Lili Taylor, Ron Livingston. Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1457767/","name":"The Conjuring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM3NjA1NDMyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQzNDMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933940/","name":"Patrick Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267812/","name":"Vera Farmiga"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0515296/","name":"Ron Livingston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179825/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179990/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370937/","name":"Chad Hayes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370928/","name":"Carey W. Hayes"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3819874585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3MjQzNDQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODAzMTg3OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3MjQzNDQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODAzMTg3OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse. Forced to confront a powerful entity, the Warrens find themselves caught in the most terrifying case of their lives. "},"datePublished":"2013-07-19","description":"Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.","keywords":"ghost,exorcism,possession,haunted house,supernatural power","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1457767/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hitchcockthelegend"},"dateCreated":"2014-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's November 1st, 1971, I'm sitting here with Carolyn Perron, who with her family, has been experiencing supernatural occurrences.","reviewBody":"The key with The Conjuring is not that it has freshness on its side, as evidenced by the ream of horror fans arguing on internet sites about "nothing new on the table" , but while those fans will be going hungry for a very, very long time, The Conjuring does everything right for the splinter of horror it deals with.

There's a lot to admire about a horror film that in this day and age stands tall and proud against the ream of remakes, sequels and teen friendly slashers that "haunt" the multiplexes with all too much frequency these days. Free of gore and sex, this was automatically going to alienate a good portion of the lustful members of the horror fan base, but for those who like their horror served with appetising scares and a cauldron of suspense, then this delivers plenty to your particular table.

Forget the "based on a true story" tag, since it's kind of irrelevant in this new technological age, it's a selling gimmick that actually means "this story might be true and we might have played with it a bit". Regardless of hoax charges and embellishments, just buy into the premise, commit to it as a scary story in the same way as director James Wan has, for then the rewards are there for the compliant.

Story essentially is based around an investigation in the early seventies by paranormal specialists Ed and Lorraine Warren, who aided the Perron family as they were victims of dreadful supernatural events at their Rhode Island home. Wan builds it deftly, letting us into the Perron families lives as they move into what they believe to be a dream home. Then things start to happen, but again Wan builds it in slow instances, creating a palpable sense of dread, his camera work intelligent. So when the big moments come they have maximum impact and have us also yearning for the Warren's to get involved.

There is no over killing of the boo-jump scares, they are placed with care and marry up superbly with the mounting tension. Naturally all the cliché conventions of the haunted house movie are here, strange smells, creaky doors, ominous cellar and etc, yet these are supplemented with Wan's talented knack for a good scare and a very effective production design. From mysterious bruises and literal leg pulls – breath holding games of hide and seek – to bona fide pant soiling moments, The Conjuring is a lesson in sustained unease until the big finale is unleashed.

The script is devoid of cheese and pointless filler, itself refreshing in a horror sub-genre that suffers often with these problems. Joseph Bishara's musical score is an absolute nerve shredder, and again it's a refreshing accompaniment because it doesn't resort to telegraphed shrieks to tell us to be afraid, it never overwhelms a scene. John Leonetti's cinematography has Gothic textures, both in the house and outside of the lakeside farmhouse, while the strong lead cast of Vera Farmiga, Patrick Wilson, Lili Taylor and Ron Livingston come up trumps for sure.

Met with critical and box office success, The Conjuring justifies its reputation as a superb haunted house movie. 9/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":465980,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

The legend associated with the monastery bode revelation in him a saint in the near future. Despite initial reluctance, Natasha starts the maintenance of the image stored there. The Book Thief
programme.desc:
The Book Thief: Directed by Brian Percival. With Roger Allam, Sophie Nélisse, Heike Makatsch, Julian Lehmann. While subjected to the horrors of World War II Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. In the basement of her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0816442/","name":"The Book Thief","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE3NzkyMjAyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDc5MTE0MDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4563869/","name":"Sophie Nélisse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001691/","name":"Geoffrey Rush"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001833/","name":"Emily Watson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093053/","name":"Brian Percival"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0226011/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420822/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2295691/","name":"Markus Zusak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0678104/","name":"Michael Petroni"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi467773465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIxODA2OTI2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI0Nzg0MDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIxODA2OTI2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI0Nzg0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While subjected to the horrors of WWII Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. Under the stairs in her home, a Jewish refuge is being sheltered by her adoptive parents. "},"datePublished":"2014-01-22","description":"While subjected to the horrors of World War II Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. In the basement of her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents.","keywords":"book,world war two,nazi,nazi germany,book burning","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0816442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ryzah"},"dateCreated":"2014-02-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't listen to the poor reviews.","reviewBody":"Orange Wednesday's are a weekly escape from the monotony of the working world (New Teacher - Little money - Stressed - Used to do absolutely nothing at Uni). Therefore over the last couple of years, as you can imagine, the cinema has been overused and a plethora of films have been watched, reviewed and loved. Being a sap myself and an ability to completely immerse myself within a movie; the usual comment coming out of the cinema is: "That was the best film I've ever seen!"...

Obviously that is never actually true, and probably isn't for this film, however I again came out the cinema saying the same thing. Within the first two months of this year: Wolf of Wall Street, 12 Years a Slave, American Hustle and Dallas Buyers Club...Now The Book Thief! 

Now I had no idea what the film was about before stepping in the cinema, except a girl who steals books in the war. Even half way through I thought this film was a heart warming film about the war through a child's eyes. I was WRONG! If you know nothing about the story, the film is beautifully written, acted, portrayed (Life of Pi creators, done it again) and has bags of shocks, emotion and heartache. The other lad who viewed the film with me(In the same boat work wise) I have never seen cry. That man was broken!

The young actress, is going to be a superstar. Geoffrey Rush, although portrayed a "Disney Dad" as some reviewers suggested; was inspirational and perfectly cast, when compared to the book, which I have now read.

Another reviewer trashed the use of "bits of German" - You sir, are a fool. This is not Hollywood tact, the book does exactly the same thing and therefore the film took that same role. 

Another reviewer gave the film "1 star" (Mainly due to the film not being realistic in 3 parts, which all played no real role in the film and therefore a poor point to make) It's a story based on some real life events, not a true story.

Rant over though, this film truly moved me (23 year old male) I know, I hid it well in the cinema! The film is just a Must see and although I probably wouldn't rate it 10 star (I never rate that highly) I felt I needed to raise the profile, due to people who have too much time on their hands to pick holes in minor parts of films and have to have their films more like a documentary, then a masterpiece for all warps of life and ages.

I will be using this in school as soon as it is out and will be a fantastic tool for developing writing!

Cracking film!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":129372,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

Remake of the 1943 movie based on Eric Knight's book "Lassie Come Home"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10384944/","name":"Lassie - Eine abenteuerliche Reise","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWE3YzAzY2EtNTJlOS00OTY2LWJhYzMtMzRlZjhjMzlhYTk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Remake of the 1943 movie based on Eric Knight's book "Lassie Come Home".","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10384944/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kovacsh-zoltan"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A modernized mixed bag, go for the 2005, or 1943 version instead","reviewBody":"Based on the classic book but in modern setting and in Germany. It is droll and less serious than the previous 2 book adaptation films (less effort by all means), some characters are overplayed or annoying, altough may be funny for the youth. The movie has sad and weepy parts as expected, but some are kind of ruined by either a milldly forced joke or odd interaction. But not all the time odd, certain side stories and characters and their relationship are well implemented. Camerawork had quite some stuttering and optic faults (lens flare, too much saturation). Music was okay, but not memorable.\n\nYou can sit down with the family for this film, but won't be a lasting experience at all. This film is "meh to okay". But the 2005 british adaptation is lasting and not to mention the classic 1943 first movie. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4096179737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVkN2UxZTgtMmZiYi00OWM0LThjMjYtOTEyMDViOTg4YjYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVkN2UxZTgtMmZiYi00OWM0LThjMjYtOTEyMDViOTg4YjYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2020-06-26","description":"A Democratic strategist helps a retired veteran run for mayor in a small, conservative Midwest town.","keywords":"political satire,american politics,election campaign,rural america,marine veteran","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9076562/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sir_AmirSyarif"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A rather toothless critique of the modern American political process","reviewBody":"Jon Stewart's 'Irresistible' is a critique of the modern American political process but it is rather toothless. The plot is rich but it only skims the surface of the problems but does not address any of it. It has some clever moments, wits, and twists. But, as a whole, it is forgettable, you wont remember or care to remember a thing after finishing the movie. The humor, in general, is too broad and feels flat. Steve Carell delivers a steadily funny and wholesome performance, while the underutilized Rose Byrne portrays the evil and seductive strategist perfectly.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La dea fortuna

La dea fortuna
programme.desc:
La dea fortuna: Directed by Ferzan Ozpetek. With Stefano Accorsi, Jasmine Trinca, Edoardo Leo, Serra Yilmaz. When Annamaria, a longtime friend of Alessandro and Arturo, ask the couple to take care of her children, the relationship between the two men reaches a point of no return." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10256570/","name":"La dea fortuna","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ0OTlmYjctNDc1NC00NDc1LWFiM2EtZWUzZTE3MTUwNTNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIzNDU1NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Annamaria, a longtime friend of Alessandro and Arturo, ask the couple to take care of her children, the relationship between the two men reaches a point of no return.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10256570/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"yusufpiskin"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pure Beauty","reviewBody":"It is a Ferzan Özpetek film with the beauty we are used to, but it still has features that distinguish it from his films. For example, Ferzan used child actors for the first time, which has a great impact on the texture of the film, both young actors.

It is a pity that it was not screened in many countries of the world, including Turkey. The blu-ray copy that came out in Europe is beautifully crafted.

The movie reminded me that I miss Ferzan the most. It's been 4 years since I've seen him. Maybe one day I'll get a Blu-Ray copy of this movie signed as well.

While even Blockbuster films were heavily affected by the covid-19 process, such naive films unfortunately boiled away.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1783,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-19","keywords":"friend,gay,gay couple,marital crisis,infidelity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4219846425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4N2NjNzMtM2QzOC00ZDM5LTk0OTgtM2U5NDJjNDgyZDRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4N2NjNzMtM2QzOC00ZDM5LTk0OTgtM2U5NDJjNDgyZDRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009629/","name":"Stefano Accorsi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0872910/","name":"Jasmine Trinca"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502412/","name":"Edoardo Leo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654858/","name":"Ferzan Ozpetek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021904/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0278508/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654858/","name":"Ferzan Ozpetek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0710011/","name":"Silvia Ranfagni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0739744/","name":"Gianni Romoli"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

Krew na betonie
Dragged Across Concrete
programme.desc:
Dragged Across Concrete: Directed by S. Craig Zahler. With Mel Gibson, Vince Vaughn, Tory Kittles, Michael Jai White. Once two overzealous cops get suspended from the force, they must delve into the criminal underworld to get their proper compensation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6491178/","name":"Dragged Across Concrete","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTk5NDQ5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxNzg0NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Once two overzealous cops get suspended from the force, they must delve into the criminal underworld to get their proper compensation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6491178/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"papoulka"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost as stupid as it is pretentious","reviewBody":"This film has maybe four minutes total where story, writing, and acting come together. Those are *solely* in a few scenes between Gibson and Vaughn. Even then it's nothing special.

The rest alternates between gaseous capital 'A' acting, repellent violence for its own sake, and idiotic plot developments. The nadir is watching the fine actress Jennifer Carpenter trying to get through what has to be the worst cameo segment ever written - so excruciatingly bad that it may go viral.

This is grade F movie making in general, sometimes sinking to Z. If you actually enjoy it, there is something seriously wrong with your mental faculties, never mind taste and discernment. So it does may some value as a diagnostic tool...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41632,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"heist,shootout,stakeout,disgraced police officer,robbery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2454829593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU0ZGZlODMtMjVlNy00M2MwLWI1ZjgtNjEzOGUwZWYxMmMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU0ZGZlODMtMjVlNy00M2MwLWI1ZjgtNjEzOGUwZWYxMmMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stolid, old guard policeman, Ridgeman and his volatile younger partner, Anthony, find themselves suspended when a video of their strong-arming tactics become the media's special du jour. Low on cash and with no other options, these two embittered soldiers descend into the criminal underworld to gain their due, but instead find far more than they wanted awaiting them in the shadows."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0457796/","name":"Tory Kittles"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951975/","name":"S. Craig Zahler"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136920/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0612274/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951975/","name":"S. The rest alternates between gaseous capital 'A' acting, repellent violence for its own sake, and idiotic plot developments. The nadir is watching the fine actress Jennifer Carpenter trying to get through what has to be the worst cameo segment ever written - so excruciatingly bad that it may go viral.

This is grade F movie making in general, sometimes sinking to Z. If you actually enjoy it, there is something seriously wrong with your mental faculties, never mind taste and discernment. So it does may some value as a diagnostic tool...","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41632,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"heist,shootout,stakeout,disgraced police officer,robbery","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2454829593","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU0ZGZlODMtMjVlNy00M2MwLWI1ZjgtNjEzOGUwZWYxMmMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU0ZGZlODMtMjVlNy00M2MwLWI1ZjgtNjEzOGUwZWYxMmMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stolid, old guard policeman, Ridgeman and his volatile younger partner, Anthony, find themselves suspended when a video of their strong-arming tactics become the media's special du jour. programme.desc: Trigger Point: Directed by Brad Turner. With Barry Pepper, Colm Feore, Eve Harlow, Carlo Rota. Follows Nicolas Shaw, a retired U.S. special operative who becomes part of an elite "invisible" team that quietly takes out the worst villains around the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13382698/","name":"Trigger Point","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2NhMjMxNzMtMDIwMC00NzQwLWI4N2ItMTVkNzNhOGIxMDJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMwMjY1MTY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows Nicolas Shaw, a retired U.S. special operative who becomes part of an elite "invisible" team that quietly takes out the worst villains around the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13382698/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"christinejoycruz"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Barry Pepper's performance was on point.","reviewBody":"Movie started slow but I appreciated the chill Barry Pepper scenes. As always, Barry gives an awesome performance whether it is just quaint moments or intense scenes. I wish there was more hand to hand combat because Barry moved really well here. Quite predictable but because the movie was well cast, it was interesting to watch their take on this type of genre. Colm Feore made his reveal quite heartbreaking. Eve Harlow could have done more action here and of course the elusive Fiona Snow should have had her time with Nicolas. I am hoping the sequel comes because I think the the characters deserve to wrap this story up. Even Irene, the bookstore lady, did a good job.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1503,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-05-18","keywords":"operation,f word,two word title,open ended,scene before opening credits","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3951804441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTExMjczMjItZjY5Yi00MDM2LWI5OWYtZjI1NmFlMWE4MmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTExMjczMjItZjY5Yi00MDM2LWI5OWYtZjI1NmFlMWE4MmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Nicolas Brazer is a retired U.S. special operative who worked in the darkest shadows of the government, part of an elite "invisible" team that quietly took out some of the worst villains around the world. After being blamed for the exposure, and ultimately the assassination, of several members of his own team, Nicolas disappeared into a life of solitude and indignity. Now, two years removed, he is reluctantly drawn back into this dangerous world - with both enemies and supposed friends coming after him - to not only clear his name, but to prevent the killing of a new generation of noble operatives."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001608/","name":"Barry Pepper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272173/","name":"Colm Feore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2602672/","name":"Eve Harlow"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0877427/","name":"Brad Turner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0641348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0394808/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0770830/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895995/","name":"Michael Vickerman"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="
